sen.j: 提籃（ていらん）は煎茶道で使う茶道具の一つ。
sen.e: "Teiran" is one of tea utensils used in senchado (the art of green tea ceremony).
Teiran is one of tea utensils used in Senchado (Japanese tea ceremony using Sencha [brewed green tea]).
sen.cmt: 用語補足を変えました。
sen.e: Teiran is one of tea utensils used in Senchado (Japanese tea ceremony using Sencha [brewed green tea]).

sen.j: 煎茶道具一式を収納する籠。
sen.e: It is a basket to put a set of utensils used in senchado in.
It is a basket to put a set of utensils used in Senchado in.
It is a basket to put a set of utensils used in Senchado in.

sen.j: 本来野点で使う道具であり、室内では余り使わないとされる。
sen.e: Teiran is originally used at Nodate (open-air tea ceremony) and is not often used at indoor tea ceremonies.
Teiran is originally used at Nodate (open-air tea ceremony) and is not often used at indoor tea ceremonies.
Teiran is originally used at Nodate (open-air tea ceremony) and is not often used at indoor tea ceremonies.
History
History
History

sen.j: 中国から煎茶が伝来したときに一緒に渡来した道具の一つ。
sen.e: Teiran is one of tools introduced to Japan upon the arrival of green tea from China.
Teiran is one of the tools introduced to Japan upon the arrival of Sencha from China.
Teiran is one of the tools introduced to Japan upon the arrival of Sencha from China.

sen.j: 文人趣味と密着した意味を持つ道具であった。
sen.e: The tool had a meaning closely related to the literati culture of that time.
The tool had a meaning closely related to the literati culture.
The tool had a meaning closely related to the literati culture.

sen.j: 文人趣味では風光明媚な場所で思いのままに茶を喫し、漢詩を読んだり絵を描くのを興趣とした。
sen.e: In the literati culture, enjoying tea as one likes while reading Chinese-style poems or drawing pictures at places of scenic beauty was regarded as artistically elegant.
In the literati culture, it was regarded as an artistically elegant by enjoying tea as one likes while reading Chinese-style poems or drawing pictures at places of scenic beauty.
In the literati culture, it was regarded as an artistically elegant by enjoying tea as one likes while reading Chinese-style poems or drawing pictures at places of scenic beauty.

sen.j: そのため、茶道具一切を屋外へ持ち運びするために誕生したのが提籃である。
sen.e: Teiran was thus developed for the purpose of taking a set of tea ceremony utensils outdoors.
Teiran was thus developed for the purpose of taking a set of tea ceremony utensils outdoors.
Teiran was thus developed for the purpose of taking a set of tea ceremony utensils outdoors.

sen.j: 大陸の文人に近づくことを目標とした日本の文人達は、煎茶道具の中でもとりわけ文人趣味の象徴といえるこの道具を寵愛した。
sen.e: Japanese literati, who adored continental literati and made it as their goal to live like them, particularly loved this tool among the utensils for green tea ceremony, since it could be regarded as a symbol of the literati culture.

Japanese literati, who adored continental literati and made it as their goal to live like them, particularly loved this tool among the utensils for Senchado, since it could be regarded as a symbol of the literati culture.

Japanese literati, who adored continental literati and made it as their goal to live like them, particularly loved this tool among the utensils for Senchado, since it could be regarded as a symbol of the literati culture.

sen.j: しかし、現代において中国で生産される物には粗製濫造品が増え、一方の国産品は煎茶道愛好家の需要や好みを満足させるレベルに達しておらず、入手が非常に困難な道具の一つとなっている。
sen.e: In our time, however, since most of teiran baskets churned out in China are increasingly inferior in quality and those produced domestically in Japan have not reached the level of satisfying demands and tastes of tea ceremony fanciers, good teiran is one of the tools rarely available in markets.

Although today, since the Teiran baskets produced by China are increasingly inferior in quality while those produced in Japan have not reached the level of satisfying demands and tastes of Senchado fanciers, good Teiran is one of the tools rarely available in markets.

Although today, since the Teiran baskets produced by China are increasingly inferior in quality while those produced in Japan have not reached the level of satisfying demands and tastes of Senchado fanciers, good Teiran is one of the tools rarely available in markets.
Shapes
Shapes
Shapes

sen.j: 竹や藤を組んで作った籠であり、長方形が多いが、円形の物もある。
sen.e: It is a basket woven of bamboo or wisteria vine and many of teiran baskets are rectangular while some have round shapes.
It is a basket woven of bamboo or wisteria vine and many of Teiran baskets are rectangular while some have round shapes.
It is a basket woven of bamboo or wisteria vine and many of Teiran baskets are rectangular while some have round shapes.

sen.j: 重箱状に2段、3段となっている物もある。
sen.e: Some types of teiran consist of two or three tiers like Jubako (multi-tiered food box).
Some types of Teiran consist of two or three tiers like Jubako (multi-tiered food box).
Some types of Teiran consist of two or three tiers like Jubako (multi-tiered food box).

sen.j: 伝世品には籠の取っ手に中国風の凝った彫刻が施された異国情緒漂わせる物も多い。
sen.e: Many of teiran baskets which have been loved and handed down from generation to generation have a decorative handle carved in Chinese style which looks exotic.
Many of Teiran baskets which have been loved and handed down from generation to generation have a decorative handle carved in Chinese style which looks exotic.
Many of Teiran baskets which have been loved and handed down from generation to generation have a decorative handle carved in Chinese style which looks exotic.
